intro: Moehringia alleizettei, commonly known as the alpine mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a small, herbaceous perennial that typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats. The plant features dense, hairy foliage and produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. It has a compact growth form, often forming a mat-like structure to withstand harsh environmental conditions. Moehringia alleizettei is adapted to cold climates and is often found at high altitudes where temperatures are low and the growing season is short.
